meanings.definition: The quality or state of being identical with or indistinguishable from oneself.
meanings.sent1: The selfsameness of the twins made it difficult to tell them apart.
meanings.sent2: Her selfsameness with her sister was uncanny.
meanings.sent3: The selfsameness of the two identical cupcakes caused confusion at the party.
meanings.sent4: The selfsameness of the two paintings was so striking that they could be mistaken for one.
meanings.sent5: The selfsameness of the two puzzle pieces made it challenging to fit them together.

meanings.definition: The state of remaining unchanged or unaltered.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the selfsameness of the old house became a comforting constant.
meanings.sent2: The selfsameness of the routine brought a sense of stability to his life.
meanings.sent3: The selfsameness of the weather forecast was both predictable and boring.
meanings.sent4: The selfsameness of the melody throughout the song created a soothing effect.
meanings.sent5: The selfsameness of the landscape never failed to bring him peace.
